instructions.1: Divide the pizza dough into 4 equal pieces.
instructions.2: Preheat the oven with a pizza stone to 500 degrees F for 30 minutes.
instructions.3: Place a large saute pan over high heat.
instructions.4: Add the olive oil and when it is hot, saute the artichoke hearts and mushrooms.
instructions.5: Season to taste with salt and pepper.
instructions.6: Pour off any excess oil and let the vegetables cool.
instructions.7: Roll or stretch the dough, 1/4 at a time, into 9-inch circles.
instructions.8: Place the dough circles, one at a time, on a lightly floured wooden peel.
instructions.9: Brush the circles to within 1-inch of the edge with chili oil.
instructions.10: For each calzone, put 1/4 of both cheeses on half of the dough, still leaving the 1-inch border.
instructions.11: Top with 1/4 of the artichokes and mushrooms, the garlic and the thyme.
instructions.12: Assemble the remaining calzones in the same way.
instructions.13: Moisten the edges of the circles with water.
instructions.14: Fold the un-topped half of the dough, trapping as much air inside as possible, over the filling and press the edges together firmly to seal.
instructions.15: With the backside of a fork, press the edges of the dough to crimp them.
instructions.16: Slide the calzones onto the pizza stone and bake about 12 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown.
instructions.17: Brush the calzones with melted butter and sprinkle them with Parmesan.
